summary: A Bureau of Prisons memorandum from a Unit Manager at the Metropolitan Correctional Center detailing the facilitation of a social phone call for inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 9, 2019, the day before his death. The memo describes escorting Epstein to a phone and him calling a number starting with 347, which he stated was his mother.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The incarcerated individual at the Metropolitan Correctional Center for whom the memorandum is written. The Unit Manager describes escorting him to make a social phone call on August 9, 2019.

events.title: Epstein's social phone call at MCC
events.description: A Unit Manager at the Metropolitan Correctional Center escorted inmate Jeffrey Epstein to a phone in the Special Housing Unit to make a social call. Epstein stated he was calling his mother. The call was ended after 15 minutes.

keyFacts: This document is a Bureau of Prisons memorandum dated August 10, 2019, regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
It details a social phone call facilitated for Epstein on the evening of August 9, 2019, the night before he was found dead in his cell.
Epstein was escorted to a phone in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and stated he was calling his mother.
The Unit Manager dialed a number starting with area code 347 for Epstein, but the specific number was not recorded in the memo.
The call was terminated after 15 minutes as directed by the Unit Manager.
